result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendan Deon Black

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kendan Deon Black in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Kendan Deon Black.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/9/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Defense Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Defense Witness List

Defendant Kendan Deon Black appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Kendan Deon Black.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kendan Deon Black in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with TNV (8/24/97)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Kendan Deon Black in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Kendan Deon Black in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kendan Deon Black appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to DV intake judge of the week.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
